content: It's good but it's not great. The whole x-ray thing is awesome & all, but I feel like being able to double tap to go back 10 seconds is more useful/helpful in the long run. As it is now, you have to tap to get rewind, pause, & fast forward to pop up & you have to be intentional about tapping on any of those or nothing will happen. Also, why the heck does it always start on a previous episode you've already watched when you open the app after having had it off for a number of hours or overnight?

It's always been a messy app. Keep watching row disappears at random, my list moves around, the included selections are very hit or miss (mostly miss), and now ads? You'd have to buy a lot of stuff on the shopping side for this service to be worth paying extra for just to take off the ads. The only reason I even gave it 3 stars is because of the programs I do like that I can't get elsewhere. For a company that has this much money, you'd think they could at least treat the customers better.

Since it's included with Prime, I've never had many issues with it. But the decision to suddenly add ads is outrageous, and then having to pay to remove them? Ads are invasive AF. A multibillion dollar company doesn't need them. Once I'm finished my current show, only rarely using this every so few months/years, I'm canceling my subscription. There are other, cheaper shopping options. Here's hoping other people do the same and speak with their wallets. Edit 01/29/24: Yeah, membership cancelled.

BY FAR the WORST streaming app. With 90-second commercials playing every 5-10 minutes, including the beginning, right after the intro and right at the end of the show. You can't go back if the commercials are on, but if you go back when they're done, you have to rewatch them. Stupid. They layout doesn't make much sense, like why do I have to hit the play button two different times for the same episode? Stupid. Alsowhy am I paying for Prime Video, then being prompted to pay more for 0 ads. Stupid

Changed to 1 star. Now I have to pay more money to Amazon for ad free viewing. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy the shows, but I paid for no ads when I subscribed and paid a monthly fee. Paying more just seems like double dipping. "Oh thank you valued member..if you really like that movie and don't want interruptions, just pay a little more." Thanks Amazon.

Prime video has gone downhill over the past couple of years in terms of selection and quality, and now since January 29 they put ads everywhere even in "free" movies, so there's really NO REASON to keep watching anything there unless you don't value your time, or are willing to bend over and pay extra for a poor selection of movies and TV shows. Uninstalling after 5+ years of (declining) use.

Prime has some great shows, some not so great. My complaint isn't the shows, but the fact that this service and Paramount+, charge a premium price for a non-commercial free experience. I thought the whole reason we were willing to pay for streaming services is to get rid of the commercials! For some reason, they think it's ok to charge AND run ads in the midst. I feel like we are being cheated. Should be free with ads.

Usually this is an ok streaming app, but as of a day or two ago, it has decided that I can only watch Audio Description tracks (which narrate over the action) and it won't let me switch to the regular audio. I'm watching Monk S1, and it's happened on multiple episodes now. It also sometimes has chunks of episodes that are skipped over, like in the middle of a conversation it jumps ahead a minute or two and no amount of rewinding will help, because the file itself must be messed up.

Why not just call Prime Video Paid Freevee now? I hope you lose more customers and the tons of revenue they generate than you could possibly recoup from your new ad insertions or the price hike to keep them ad-free. I get a 50% discount on Prime due to my financial circumstances. I have no intention or ability to "upgrade" here, and your new interruptions kill the whole experience, and that's not what we pay you for. I can already buy nearly everything available on Amazon for less on eBay. Pfft.

I would have expected Amazon of all companies to use their revenue to create a streaming platform (+ mobile app) that meets or beats the standards set by other streaming services. However, the UI is clunky, the account features are impossible to navigate, and the video perpetually lags behind the audio by 1-2 seconds. (And this happens with downloads on Airplane Mode too, so I know it's not my internet speed). Overall such a disappointing, lazy streaming competitor. Get good scrubs.

I used to love prime video. I've had it for years. So long I don't even remember when I first signed up. Now it plays ads even when you pay for the service. A show I was watching uninterrupted just a week ago now has ads breaking up the experience. It's awful. Then it asked if I wanted to upgrade.. why would I upgrade to a more expensive version that's just the same version I was paying for previously?

this app works better on my chromebook than it does on my firestick. on chromebook the audio is synced with the captions which is not the case with the firestick version. highly disappointing that they just added ads to shows and movies and it costs an additional $3 per month to go ad free - on top of $139 per year for Prime. the service had an acceptable variety of shows and movies available, but I wish there were more. More shows and fewer ads would equate to more stars in the rating.

High price for low content. I had prime video for years as it was included in my prime subscription. In 2023 Amazon decided to increase the price of the yearly subscription. The variety of free movies did not change, the quality of shows did not change, and yet the price went up. Now in 2024 they started including ads in addition to the extra cost they charge me and have the audacity to ask for MORE money to remove the ads. Ridiculous.

It's decently designed, and it is easy to use. However, it isn't easy to remove movies that have been watched by accident or movies that couldn't be finished. There should be a remove or delete button it the watch option is no longer available. Other than that the or features are great and there is great collection available for use.

I used to really like this application but since they incorporated ads which causes my TV to crash non-stop and I can't even watch it. I'm thinking about canceling it. You force me to watch ads on an application that doesn't even freaking work because you added ads! Halfway through a show it always says there was a problem. The problem isn't on my end, it's on your end and you need to fix it. There's no point in paying for service I can't use.

I have been using the Prime Video app on my Samsung S20 Ultra in recent days. The quality seems unusually poor. Brightness is too low on all my phones and tablets. Why isn't the 'Continue Watching' part at the top of the page? It feels like I need to hunt for it. I can't find a filter to only show programs that I have access to under Prime membership and it is so annoying to be part way through a movie on one evening to find out the next day it has been pulled from the listings with no warning.

The UI is pretty atrocious and difficult to navigate with any sense of direction. It just feels like hey here's additional services and advertising more than letting me actually look for what's available to me. And now they've started adding adverts to content that was previously ad-free. I will be canceling my prime subscription as I don't feel like I'm getting my money's worth. They keep just asking for more.

I have used every streaming service available in the US and Amazon Prime Video is still my "go to", although I'm not sure why. I have a list of shows that i rewatch every year (I am very much a creature of habbit) and every year I would watch them on Prime, but at random times with no apparent reason some of my shows are not available or only the first few seasons are available. Recently the app on my Chromebook and Android TV will just decide to go to the home page while I'm looking for a show.

Don't bother with Prime. They charge exstra to get rid of commercials. Might as well just pay for cable or get what you like on dvd. Streaming services are dead now. There is no difference from cable so it's basically pointless. Save your time and money for better things. I haven't watched a single thing since they added the commercials. Letting my subscription run out and will not be renewing it.

What a mess. very difficult to find shows that are included in your subscription. searching for your show brings up 32 different choices to view, all of them but 1 is included with your subscription. 31 clicks later you will find witch one is the one you subscribe to... app is polluted with frevee, if I wanted freevee I would install it. have the same package I have paid for for years but they want more money to remove adds. I don't see how this is legal. should be if you want adds pay less

Yeah sure. Wide selection and the videos work, and then you pay for prime, and for years you have no ads. And then all of a sudden you have to pay $3 extra for them to stop playing freaking ads. I've literally never complained about an app before because I usually just don't care. But don't charge us to have the service and then charge us for no ads. Canceling all prime

For something that originated as a free benefit for Prime members this app has become less free & less benefit over the years. Originally they offered an amazing selection of free videos to choose from. Over the years the free selections have become less and less and now most stuff you need to buy, rent, pay to subscribe to a 3rd party or pay Amazon more money to have a little broader access. Now you watch unskippable ads on all the "free" movies you watch, or pay an extra fee to remove ads.

I'm already paying for service but now I have to pay another $4 a month so I don't have to watch ads? The service has a very limited selection and most of it is tv shows and movies that don't even qualify as B grade. A lot of their shows were never even popular. I've uninstalled the app from my devices and deleted the shortcut for Prime video on my desktop. I already pay enough for Hulu, Netflix and Paramount. I'm already paying almost as much as cable.

I really enjoyed it until they decided to add ads to the paid service. I despise ads, and if I got an email saying something like "due to the economy your subscription price is going up" I would've been fine. There's a negative connotation to "hey we added ads to your current subscription! Pay us more money to remove it again" therefore canceling my prime and not upgrading.

Still don't like the app. I have to pay for too many movies even though I'm a Prime Member. The aspect ratio is off on my Samsung TV and won't let me change it. You're more expensive than. You Tube and they have a lot of the same moves. Sometimes for free - work no membership required. And rented movies are available for longer than just 48 hours. Still do NOT like this app. Again, all the most interesting movies and series require renting or purchasing...so frustrating.

The app used to work fine with my phone and Chromecast up until a few months ago. All of a sudden I am no longer to cast from my phone to my TV via Chromecast. All other streaming services cast just fine except for Amazon prime. When I try to cast, my phone starts blinking and I have to power off my phone to stop it. I don't know what they did to the app to cause this but it just started a couple months ago and has not gone away. Amazon technical support is of no help.

Very reliable streaming, including cable networks, even over weak celular. Too much content, such as movies and additional channels, requires additional purchase beyond Prime membership monthly fee, as does cable network programming. It is expensive, but there is a large variety of programming available, reliable streaming, and many downloadable programs and movies.

"Greed is good" if on Wall Street, not for streaming!! Already pay for Slime, oops, mean Prime. But now they went to ads for Prime programming. I purchase a lot of shows & movies, so I don't have to watch ads & have content cut to fill time slots. But now Amazon wants to extort more money from customers who don't like ads, REALLY?!!! Better off checking out Netflix for programming. They have better self produced content, whether it's movies or series & no ads. Amazon Prime Sucks @ss with ads!

Not a bad app but last month they said they are starting ads on Jan 29. You used to be able to skip the promo video before a tv show or movie but now the skip button is gone. Now they say for 2.99 a month the ads will go away. Thete isn't even a yearly option to save soke money. If this ends up like amazon music, I will stop using the service. The quality of the music went down and now I pay for spotify. Looks like I will look ibto other streaming services for video.

I've been a loyal Prime customer and enjoy streaming at my convenience. Changes in the format to simply choose a show as well as changes to the viewing experience leave me frustrated every time I log on to the Prime site, however. CHOOSING A SHOW TO WATCH: 1. Mixing included and non included products is down right irritating. I don't want to grocery shop. I want to relax at a site where my membership allows me to relax. 2. The myriad of collections for yet another $... per month. Greedy, much?

Once was a wonderful streaming service now just like cable. Opened my app to find a great notice stating Amazon Prime sold out and now has commercials and I could upgrade to "ad-free" if I wanted to pay more per month. Yeah doubt I'll be subscribing to Netflix much longer considering all the up charges in recent years and I've been with them for over a decade.

I recently got a prime membership and was enjoying the movies and music but now the adds have ruined it. Any of the subscriptions I pay for are all add free. That's what you're paying for. Nothing but pure greed. I will be cancelling my prime membership today. I spend around $2 k a month on Amazon mostly because the big box stores have become greedy with their prices. It's no longer advantageous to pay for a service that doesn't save money anymore. The adds pushed me off. Enough.

There's ads even though I pay for prime and now I have to pay MORE if I don't want ads. I'm done using streaming services considering they're just as inconvenient as watching cable and you have to pay extra to watch anything good. No point in even being a prime member anymore, they can keep losing their money and I'll be watching the shows/movies elsewhere. Check for apps that connect with your local library and you can get lots of good movies/shows for FREE.

When I purchase a video streaming app. Usely no ads r part of it ! now extra for no ads. again for something that every other steaming service makes part of the Initial price and always have!!?? Prime already been slipping Commercials before every movie You go to watch!Another way to gauge a little more money out of the public!!! Guess it's time to change streaming services!! Prime is not the best choice for $$!! Making billions off of the public But still Fill need to Do this!!

FreeVee was the warning bell, but adding commercials to all of your features is complete and utter insanity!!! The only reason you have a customer base in the first place, is because you were offering content without commercials! This is a major step backwards and a major FU to your customers. Personally, I wish Freevee would be stripped out of your service, it's complete trash.

a company worth 2 trillion dollars doesn't need to start showing ads on their shows to make more money. Then charging people even more than they're already paying to opt out of seeing the ads is ridiculous. We canceled our Amazon subscription. on top of that the Paramount+ that we were subscribing to through Amazon is also filled with ads. I had to cancel the Paramount subscription through Amazon and then resubscribe through Paramount by itself to keep Amazon's ads out of our shows. No more.

It was alright as far as video streaming apps went. But recently they decided to demand ransom or else play ads when on already paying too much for Prime's ever increasing prices. And like, the commercials aren't subtle. They but in mid scene and are obscenely loud compared to the show. Not to mention you have to wait through them in case you accidentally clicked on the wrong episode. Hot garbage now, do not recommend

One of the best place for a one stop app for all your shows and movies. However recently they've started to become cheeky with their prime commercials to where even if u have prime 0 commercials theirs will still pop up before a program starts and a pop up alert will force you to watch it as it covers the skip button. May lower my review if this persists.

Ads. I've been a prime member for over a year and a half I started using the perks which prime video was included as subscription unfortunately Amazon. Along with Netflix has become a pay a higher premium for an ad free experience after already paying a premium for having that benefit. Soon people will just have to compare cable and pirated content with these streaming services that think its OK to pay for ads.

Adding ads diminishes the user experience. For what I'm paying for Amazon Prime, the Amazon team needs a reality check. This is not cable TV!!!!!!! Really disappointed and will be cancelling my Prime subscription. Amazon is no better than TEMU lately anyways with their products. The majority of their products are all cheap knockoffs. I guess their streaming platform is following suit with ads and C or D tier movies such as Transmutators or Titanic 2... Yeah, top notch programming! Not worth it.

Firestick for prime is terrible. I have to constantly restart firestick because prime bugs. Videos always come up as error/ unavailable to play and i have click around it 8 different ways to trick the video into playing. None of my other streaming services do this so i know its prime. The sound will slow way down and you have to reset or its off a second or two from the video playing and have to reset. I never know if im actually going to get to watch a video or after 20mins of trying, give up

The app itself is okay at best. The algorithm that suggests movies based on " what I've watch" only recommends movies I would never watch. It crashes less often than some of the others. Banners do pop up over the movie without pausing the movie on a fairly regular basis. Overall, not a great experience, but I've had worse.

Well... great move adding ads for Prime members. Really appreciate the nickle and dime strategies. The proliferation of this policy is getting old. Not worth my time anymore. You should really reduce the prime main subscription every time you do things like this because you've essentially taken away a benefit of that subscription with this and similar policies. Good luck with your ethical dilemma... oh wait, prime main sub went up lol (2 stars for range of options, -3 for the rest)

Free trial doesn't apply to ad-free plan, immediately charges the "2.99," which is actually 3.24 because even though it's a digital purchase of a service with nothing to ship it has tax. Only downloaded to watch hazbin hotel, if it were on literally any other streaming service, even a more expensive one, I'd get that instead, because screw this ad nonsense on a **paid** service. It's like they're competing with Netflix of how much they can piss people off before they lose all their customers.

I love the amount of possibilities you have on your platform. I enjoy the fact it is a potential hub for all your other subscription services one may also subscribe to. Now the bs ads initially before this new 2.99 need to get rid of ads... Once again. Was more about who's too lazy to open the app and hit skip.... Why would this not just be a function on the stream controller on a phone (android) Now that it cost $2.99 and having MGM+ for another charge... When you own them... Is pure Greed.

App is fine, but for how much Prime costs, the recent move to soaking us for more money or suddenly have to deal with commercials (way to breach an implied contract) is a real douche move. Maybe spend less developing original programming or charge the premium for things like the NFL games, which it may come as a shock but some people don't care about. Or just split off video and have it be its own subscription, not bundled with a dozen other things.

So absolutely my only problem with Prime video are the commercials. It's actually worse than regular TV especially because it's the same commercials over and over once you force me to watch one once I've seen it I don't need to see the same commercial 15 more times in the one episode that I watch. Plus to be honest this is a service that I pay for and if I'm going to pay for something I want the option of not watching commercials.

The cost of subscription was worth it initially for free shipping plus ad free Prime video but now they're introducing ads UNLESS their customers pay extra. (as if they're not already getting plenty of money by getting a cut of the profits for sales ON TOP of their monthly fees just to have free shipping on most - not all - items.) I find it hard to believe one of the richest companies in the world can't continue operating as they have been for years without adding extra fees. Don't waste your $

I haven't seen any other app that has a worser search feature. It feels like Amazon has no interest in improving this app, since it comes as a default service with prime. No way to search properly by year or by keywords or partial names of shows or movies. Google is better as showing the latest launches on this app than Amazon themselves.

The app and the service has always felt cumbersome and a constant need to change filters to free to me. The view should default to what I am currently subscribed to. We normally just binge watch a series so we have just dealt with the frustration. Now that commercials have been added with time remaining on my annual prime subscription I am not happy about that.

I have only one tiny complaint with this streaming app... I would like to know when certain things (that are not available currently) will or should be available. I have been trying to watch the ONLY movie from trailer park boys, that I have not watched yet, and it shows that Prime is the only streaming app that has it. However, it shows that it's not available to watch(or purchase) currently. But it doesn't give me a specific time/date that it will be available. other than that, I love it!

Mostly this gets a one star. UX is terrible. AMZ Corporate shoves AMZ based content down your throat. How? By pushing their ADS, regardless of your PAID AD-FREE SUBSCRIPTION. Conveniently, the skip button is covered by the pop up for the add. This is an obstacle that plagues the UX across multiple devices. A choice corporate, is aware of. It's like a bad sci-fi book from when tapes took up the whole 3rd floor. Dot matrix printers were the norm.

Who do I contact to get my money back? The videos are blurry and if they start out normal it instantly becomes blurry again. But at least the ads are perfectly clear and never have the blurring issues. Is it a scam that your paying amazon for streaming yet you can only watch ads which they make a fortune on? Even after updating the up it's still blurring and again only the ads are perfectly clear.

I don't use this much app anymore. It tends to be glitchy and Amazon Prime video selection is not what it used to be. Many of the movies/shows that are popular require a subscription to another streaming service. Now, what IS included in Prime isn't commercial free anymore. They want us to pay a monthly fee to have the service they took away. Not finding many reasons to stay a Prime member, so this app isn't useful.

If I pause it and come back to it sometimes it resets to a separate episode like the previous one, or I open it up and it starts me off on the episode I've already seen. Not where I've left off, also the new ads are extremely annoying, sometimes I will pause and I would have to watch an ad again even though I've already watched an ad, or if it's an episode I've already seen and somehow it restarted I have to watch one or two ads in order to get back to my spot.

ads... ads...? Correct me if I'm wrong but did you not, like a dealer, get us all hooked on prime video (with zero advertising) as a complete part of your prime service only to add yet another paid portion... now you want another 2.99 for ad free viewing. It's honestly not even the money. It's the fact that in 4 years the ad free portion is going to increase conveniently to roughly the same price as Netflix per month all the while I'm sure prime itself will also creep in price. So We Pay U More

Unskippable ads when you pay for ad free, and ads for suggested shows that pop up before the credits even begin to roll, taking you out of the movie. I don't need a giant ad for The Cable Guy during the emotional climax of Ghost. Clunky UI, difficult and tedius to rewind or fast forward, more than half the time subtitles are a good 30 seconds behind the dialogue.

More and more of the movies and TV shows are migrating to the freevee platform which play commercials. I pay for Prime primarily to avoid commercials. If they're gonna play Freevee content with all the commercials here on Prime then I'm just gonna drop Prime. That and now commercials on the all the live events and certain movies and TV shows makes it no longer worth the money. Doesn't make much sense to pay Prime prices for Freevee content.

They've added ads to a service we never asked to be included with an Amazon Prime subscription, and they don't give an option to have a cheaper subscription without video streaming, but only an ad free version for more money. Their exclusive content is not worth more than we already are forced to pay. They are trying to reinvent streaming, but are instead reverting to another version of the failing model of cable subscription. Their entire streaming model shows us more of the greed of Amazon.

Don't waste your money, they ask you to pay a monthly subscription cost, only for half the available shows to still need to be rented or bought, think Netflix, if you had to then pay a separate cost just to watch most of what you wanted to watch. Just go on YouTube, you'll have the same experience and aren't required to pay for a subscription, thank God for the 30 day trial.

I've been a prime member for 10+ yrs. I loved their music and video apps. It was amazing that both were included with my prime membership. They took away an amazing music app & ran it into the ground. Now, they're killing their video app adding ads to already paying, LONG TERM members. Why pay $120+/yr for prime, then have to pay almost the same for their ad free video service, & again for the music? Switching to paid Spotify and watching TubiTV for free. Amazon is gonna be Amagone soon.

The Prime app has been my favorite for years- it has a lot of classic content which doesn't make rounds on the other streaming services, an enormous documentary selection, plus some of my favorite obscure TV. But now that they've followed suit with the others and started with all the commercials, it immediately moved to my dislike list. Overadvertising is directly responsible for a large part of society's rage. Please do away with the ads!!!

To me, it's ridiculous that amazon first wants us to pay a subscription fee now because they decide there money hungry they want us to give more money a month on top of a subscription to not have to deal with ads. What's the point of having a subscription at all at that point since its purpose is to not have to deal with ads, especially when theres already shows and movies you can't watch unless you pay extra. Crazy how greedy these companies are getting.

Updates keep worsening the app. First they made it require more steps to get to downloads. NOW, the screen keeps flipping to small view, whenever the screen slightly moves. The xray feature, which I've always enjoyed, is much harder to use (involves more clicks to access things) even though it now pops up right away. It was so much better before.

Why is it that when I start a movie on my TV, when switch to the mobile app on my phone partway thru, that suddenly, the only available audio is the one with audio descriptions!? I paid for the video, and I would like to watch it without all the extra junk thrown in! I tried to switch it back to English with no descriptions, but even though it was a visible option, it wasn't available and greyed out. While it's good to have accessibility options, forcing it on people who don't want it sucks.

Too many ads/commercials. The content of the commercials is really terrible. They are out of touch, boring and unappealing to say the least. I think I'd rather just watch regular tv than put up with all that. Plus there are so many hoops to jump thru to buy or rent a movie now that I just stopped doing either. Amazon is getting really pushy -the ads are every 7 minutes now. App freezes all the time since the update. Even more annoying than before. Negative 5 stars!

Regularly experience video play back errors on multiple devices over multiple different data connection paths. Data connections have plenty of available bandwidth. I would never pay extra for anything on prime video with this kind of subpar performance especially considering there are several other options. Tired of getting the generic "Something went wrong. Please try again later." and "Internet connectivity issue" error messages. So glad Hulu and Netflix don't have these issues

I have a theory that Amazon purposefully overcompresses or degrades quality, at least on Google devices. Many shows look terrible, and I have a pretty standard 4k TV. Also, subtitles for foreign language shows are very often late and completely out of sync. It's been that was for years (look up reddit threads from 2019 and prior). Just horrendous experience.

Love the service, HATE THE ADS! This new ads/trailers that have been added is one big problem for me. However my MAIN ISSUE is the volume level for the ads/trailers. Why does the ads/trailers have to be 300% louder than what I'm watching??? I have this issue on my phone, and my Google TV/Chromecast. Fix it and I'll fix the stars rating to 5.

I am so sick of streaming services' new trend of adding in ads. What have I been paying you for, and for how long, just for streaming services; I almost never use any other prime features, and now you're putting in ads, which is why people got rid of cable in the first place. To top it off, the rates have already been going up prior to this. Get rid of the ads! And no, I'm not upgrading to the next tier, because why would I pay you more for something that I've already had, which increased.

Would like to see less horror and more happy movies or shows. Drama and action are great. Wish there were more shows made that compares to Yellowstone. Do not like 1923 on Paramount. That why I cancelled. They have very little that's new. I'd be lost without Amazon... Your app makes everything easier. So thank you! I'm on a strict budget at 73 years old. Enjoy the British apps. So I've learned how to choose better. I don't enjoy horror spoofs... I'm forever having trouble with firetv

The introduction of ads on something I paid in advance for with no ads is absolutely unacceptable, and you will be losing a subscriber after this cycle. If I wanted to see ads during my viewing experience, I would have stayed with cable. So now you're getting paid to air these ads, and you want the consumer to pay to remove the ads you got paid to air, double dip price gouge. Back to Netflix I go.

I have had Amazon Prime for several years. Now that they have added ads, I am considering canceling it. I heard they were adding advertising. I was hoping it would be a few commercials, however, it's almost as bad as regular TV. I am not even halfway through the movie and have already watched 12 commercials. I hate it. They also took away the ability to remove shows and movies from the continue watching list. Instead of getting better, it has gone downhill.

Ads are poorly placed. Transition between the ads and episodes is appalling. On top of paying monthly, they now want you to pay them extra to stop poorly executed ads meanwhile they still can't get their subtitles right nor the videos uploaded in the correct order or fail to upload all the episodes for a series and also included poor video quality but hey let's throw in some badly placed ads to continue the subpar service. Use to love this app, now I just avoid it.

Less than optimized. Samsung Galaxy s23 ultra. Service is fine, movies have been downloaded, and every 30 seconds the visuals stutter. It seems there is an issue in application code and Samsung. Even if I'm watching a movie or TV series I've downloaded, I experience stuttering.

I'm really disliking the autoplay feature. I would like to be able to set autoplay for shows and miniseries, but turn it off for movies. Like, just because I watch a movie (especially ones that I have purchased) does not mean I want whatever random movie Amazon associates with that movie to just automatically play after it's done. However, I DO want the series I watch to autoplay the next episodes, and, unfortunately, there isn't a separate setting for that.

EDIT (JAN 2024): dropped another star because Amazon now inserts ads, while still charging same amount for Prime. This company is rapidly losing all factors that used to make using their services a worthwhile experience. App is good, unless you have the parental restriction PIN selected. Then it's clunky and not at all streamlined like the rest of the experience.

You guys had a system crash and when you came back on sale was there but prime video was not. When I pair my phone with prime it works until it switches to my tv no pictures no sound and pairing disconnects this has been going on 4 months or so. Yesterday I tried it again now i have sound but no pictures on tv. We re half way there if we can get picture or I ll have to cancel if I'm not going to get prime video. I'm only getting half of what I'm paying for. If not maybe I need to call FCC. And

Love Prime Video in general, but the app on all platforms leave much to be desired. Have to get rid of the side scrolling or at least have the option to skip every 4 or 5 titles at a time. Again, if you are going to have a genre page, then an option to scroll 4 or 5 at a time would be wonderful. Searching titles one at a time is painstakingly time consuming. The same goes for being able to scroll pages of all titles for each channel. It's monotonous! Like this review!

When I start a video in portrait mode it does not automatically switch to landscape mode even if I'm holding my phone on it's side. Very annoying and inferior to Netflix. It is also very annoying that every time I pause and push play, the list of actors reappears on the left of the screen, then the warnings for foul language and the like appear at the top superimposed over the video. Very annoying, and detracts from the experience. Show the warnings only once at the beginning of a video please.

Ads, it was only a matter of time. Later in Jan '24 will start the inevitable downfall of the service with ads. When the time comes to renew prime, I don't think I will. If Amazon Music was anything to go by, they kept removing functionality over and over. In Music I can't even pick a song or album to play, it just shuffles a random collection around that song. This is not a customer focused approach, it's one after more money at the customer's expense.

Disappointing. Every time I try to watch the Thursday night football through Amazon prime video, the audio is not sync, it is so annoying that I haven't watched a single game this year for Thursday night. I keep forgetting about the audio, then I select the game and there is, lips moving but audio is off sync. This only happens with the game, it doesn't happen while watching any movie or show. Why?

Amazon Prime video was a pretty good for movie and TV shows. Now all you see is content from Freevee more the you do included with Prime. If you subscribe to any of the channels you end up paying to see episodes because they don't have the full content from that service. It would be cheaper just to get the apps on your TV to get full access. Now I get an email saying that they are putting adds in all programs and movie. They want you to pay more to keep everything add free. Hog wash.

Its temperamental. It will work fine for about an hour then it will skip and glitch and the loading circle of death appears and doesn't go away. Then it will just stop working all together. I am able to open it but when I hit play the video is a black screen with the occasional loading spiral. Its incredibly frustrating. I have to restart my phone for it to work again. And that doesn't always work.

Worst video app by far. Prime on every device is absolutely horrible. It's what you would expect from an early 2000's application. Horrible compression on the video side of things. Horrible layout and terrible application issues (crashing, freezing) Also, give us the option to not see the things we have to pay for. I'm so tired of seeing a movie that I want to watch but have to purchase that I will never use this app again. Had Prime for years.

At the end of January Amazon is jacking up the price by 33 percent unless you accept advertising. Half of the content on Prime is stuff from FreeVee with all the commercials intact anyway. I subscribed to Prime to get away from the ads. The other channels (Paramount Plus, Britbox, etc.,) can be had on other platforms for a more affordable price. Just isn't worth having anymore.

Amazon video app mixes the prime free videos with other videos that require you to rent or purchase, or has advertisement. I should be able to select only the free video that I want to see and not even waste time seeing the others to determine if they are free. In addition, I should be able to delete movies that I don't want to continue watching but I can not. The videos with commercials will not allow you to just slide the play bar to the end to finish out the video either.

No more ads! In Jan 2024 prime is moving to a monthly fee for removing ads. We already pay for prime. Not happy about this. I also can't stand their Freeve app and there's no way to filter out Freeve videos in the prime app. Tubi has the max amount of time for ads that I will deal with and it is free. Freeve ads are super excessive. I can't get into anything because of the constant long ad interruptions. I can't express how much I hate all these ads! Other than that, the prime app is functional

Overall: Prime movies is TWO stars. (The older series/movies are great!) Programming is pretty run of the mill and same as most places. Never liked how free movies are so difficult to find. The pay to watch stuff, is slammed in everyone! I just got an email saying they're adding ads to all their movies and series on the 29th of Jan. Very sad. They first bucherd Prime music, now Prime video is next. Might is well go back to Netflix. The UI is better.

I loved the app until the recent update. Now picture in picture I can't pause it and trying to open back to full screen causes severe hangups. I've tried uninstalling twice, restarting the phone, clearing cache, etc but still doesn't work correctly. Please fix! Also the new ads version is awful.

It used to be a five star app before they decided to sneak in a fee to remove ads like every streaming app has made ads inevitable. Prime was always ad free until now. The whole point of why we switched from cable to streaming was because they didn't have ads. Now the only way to avoid advertisements is to start making a DVD collection... not purchased from Amazon.

Amazon Prime Video is a bit below par compared to other streaming media. There is some good content but quantities are quite limited. Similarly, the app lacks some features present in similar apps. The worst feature is its poor implementation of chromecast and its inability to function even when the mobile device screen is being cast to a local device through Google's Home app that is capable of casting the mobile device screen to a nearby TV.

Ads... really? I'm fine with promoting other shows to watch, but ads in the middle while I'm watching a video, that's a big no. Front load it all at the start of the video, especially since they aren't skipable. Being interrupted is not acceptable. Why not promote other services offered by Amazon or personalized ads from each user's Amazon Prime account for purchases rather than some commercial no one is interested in.

The casting stops and loads every 10 minutes or so, and I have to resort to Casting just to get it to play on my Android TV. All it says on my TV is "Your device isn't compatible with this version". Please fix this, so I can use the Google TV app properly, because it's causing problems.

Along with the addition of ads, the app itself is pretty sucky. There is no way to adjust the brightness of any of the videos, so I can barely see about 90% of the videos I try to watch. This is an ongoing problem that's been well documented by 100s of users. I resent the fact that now I will have to endure ads to watch a video I can barely see.

It's not a bad app, easy to navigate and sort, but content is average. I'm very disappointed that they're forcing in advertisements throughout the playback. Defeats the reason I got a streaming app. I don't mind the commercials before and after, but not this new system they have going on.

Poor quality app. Ads pop up before commercial break segments. Randomly during dialog ad pops up and cuts off the scene only to bring u back just as a a commercial break segment happens and goes to black before the next scene. Quality is bad on anything less then the newest hardware. As time goes on the app stops supporting certain models of devices forcing u to have the newest device or otherwise you fall victim bugs. Overall its a very basic app that is annoying because they are greedy !

The only reason I have Prime is because it came with Prime shipping. The algorithm is awful and focuses on other services. The selection is mostly low budget or originals that are mediocre at best. The quality of the stream can be very sketchy as well. Other apps will stream fine while Prime will skip and buffer. There are a couple of things on here that I watch but nowhere near enough to pay for it by itself.

So we love all of the viewing options, you literally don't need another streaming app, from Paramount to max! However, it loads very slowly, also when I go into my watchlist to watch a saved movie, say transformers, all of a sudden it will say a completely different movie and title but the description will be about transformers, so I have to delete them and re-add from the search. Weird?!

Update: 7 Jan 24 - still have difficulty watching shows that were downloaded. Bought six seasons of one of my favorite shows. I downloaded some episodes so that I could watch on the plane. During flight, the app wouldn't allow me to watch material that I had already bought. There should not have been a licensing issue. There wasn't a licensing issue when I purchased the product.

The app ALWAYS has a black screen when I launch. Have to relaunch the app 3 to 10 times. My major issue with the app is that you cannot make any digital purchases on movies/shows. When I click to purchase through Amazon on a web browser, it just opens up the prime video app. I have to go into desktop mode to get it to work. Please fix the functionality so that this process is easier. There are WAY too many steps just to buy or rent a movie. Worst streaming app I've used.

I do not appreciate the price hike with nothing to show for it... So I guess now you have adds getting revenue from that on top of people who don't want their shows and movies interrupted by adds... And without warning too I turn on prime I get a notice. If you want your original service you have to pay 3 dollars extra... It's almost criminal extortion

1 star because of the ads coming to Prime Video. I have 2 complaints. Even though the movie says it's available in 4K, when I play the movie, it only goes up to 1080pI waited a few minutes to see if it would go up, but nothing happened (and yes, my phone is fully capable of watching movies in 4K). My other complaint is that in some movies, the app doesn't give me the option to buy the movie directly, and instead, it just tells me to buy it from the Amazon app. Overall, I love this app

I like the app. But I am tired of Amazon's constant pushing of shows I am not interested in. For instance, I don't want to see shows with drag queens. And I don't like it when the Fire TV version of the app blasts out noisy previews of shows when it is first turned on. I can't even mute the sound for the first few seconds.

This app is awful, not sure why they bother having one. It's very slow, takes forever movies or shows to start IF you can find anything worth watching. Not a big selection. I find myself using it less and less. Free streaming apps on Roku have much better selections and aren't slow to load. You would think with the money Amazon makes they would spend some of it on improving Prime. Update: Amazon Prime still sucks. I only us eit to watch Teacher. Terrible app

I loved this app until recently. I don't know if it was an update or what, but some of your best features are GONE. I can no longer "go to album" or "go to artist" from the current song playing. Can't play on repeat anymore. Now I have to search for the artist or album in the search bar. I listen while I'm on the clock for work, so that's not convenient at all because I have to stop what I'm doing. Before, I could do it with just a couple of clicks. Change it back and I'll gladly give 5 stars.

Horrible, decided to get the app mainly bc I don't alway have access to my browser. Thought it would be simple bc I would just log in with my Amazon account, it kept denying it even after changing my account password on Amazon and then when I did it from the app it sent it to a number that I no longer had or ever had connected to my account, and the only way to change that is to go call customer support which I can't do. Please fix this otherwise I'll just give Amazon itself a bad review

Amazon is already extremely overpriced, and now they're charging you an extra $2.99 a month if you want ad free viewing on Prime video, which just so happens to be my most used feature ads no matter what medium they're in are unacceptable and this is a completely unacceptable change, so I will be ending my annual purchase of Prime Membership. instead, I think I'll pay monthly when I need it to purchase something on Amazon; otherwise, they don't deserve a single dime.

Streaming almost always lags or freezes intermittently regardless of network or connectivity. Now, despite being a paid service, they've included ads with all includes movies and shows. You can remove ads by paying an extra fee on top of your prime membership that you are already paying. So not only does the streaming service only sometimes work, but the times it does, you'll be interrupted regularly anyway so that ol Jeff can afford another private cruise ship.

It's awful, paying for a movie from 2006 when I already pay for a subscription. Then it lags and skips every two minutes. None of the lines line up with the actors. Spent whole night restarting fire stick deleting apps , clearing cache , restarting wifi. Not only still doing it, also boots me back to the home screen. Paying for an evening of aggravation!

For the longest time the app would only work if I cleared cache and data before launching. Then about a month ago that quit working and I had to uninstall and reinstall the app everytime before launching for it to even work. Now the app is so broken that reinstalling does not fix the problem. When I launch the app I get a black screen. And nothing else. How is this one of the biggest companies in the world? They can't even build a working app? Pathetic.

Overall it's fine. Don't like this new, when u turn it up & down, instead of landscape, it lists actors...but not much else u can do here. Id rather it did nothing. Biggest pet peeve is...I connect via network not wifi..so every time i start an episode, it's 10 second message about using data...& I cant get rid of it. Super annoying...& I can't skip the ad. Oh & the ads. Stop showing me things. Don't recommend things. I am less likely to watch it. Don't care about next generation of surfers

A pop up message appear in the middle of the screen "SUBTITLES ARE UNAVAILABLE FOR YOUR SELECTED LANGUAGE." It's annoying and it doesn't go away. I pay for Prime, I would think I get better streaming. Can't enjoy any streaming at all now. Very Disappointed. Also, all the subtitles & languages are reset to original settings. Same issues.

Honestly, the only issue I have with this service is an annoying bug that has existed for years. The app sometimes will not keep track of progress. No matter what I do, sometimes it will show my "continue watching" as a specific episode and never change no matter how many more episodes I watch. It just gets stuck. It isn't a dealbreaker or anything, but it is seriously irritating that I have to read through the description of the episodes just to find my place in a show. Please fix this

The video quality is so poor, it's weird. Sometimes it chooses to stream in decent quality, but often it will just stay hella blurry for minutes on end. I have plenty of bandwidth and streaming quality is set to "best". It just doesn't work right most of the time. I had to pirate the last few episodes of Reacher just to watch it in decent quality.

This app takes too long to play a movie and when it does it's pixelated for over 2 to 3 min into a movie or series before it clarifies. I have the fastest service on the market and top of the line cellphone. Only this app takes forever or tells you it can't play. Don't have issues like this with paramount plus, Netflix, ect.. Please fix it, I love the shows you produce..

Very Mid app. If you're watching something super popular or recent, you can be sure it will work well. If you're watching something more obscure, like Star Gate Atlantis, you will find many functions like "Skip Intro" to not work, and entrie seasons not ordered properly, as it will jump from season episode number listing to series episode number listing at random. This makes watching the series in proper order excessively difficult, and all due to laziness and oversite on their part.

Going yo be forcing commercials on me this year. I pay fot prime, I pay for multiple subscription services through prime, I buy movies on prime, and now they're inflicting ads on me. Why not just go back to having cable at this point. Prime video sucks now, and if it wasnt for the fact that I use my Amazon prime membership frequently, I would be getting rid of it. Next thing they're gonna say is I can pay extra to get rid of ads. As if I don't spend enough money on Amazon every month.

Better than Max, Paramount & Peacock and slightly better than Hulu. I love Thursday night football now! Easy to control the app, and the x-ray is awesome! Best feature is being able to pause the screen and seeing the actors portraited in the scenes, so amazing! And when music is playing, you don't need Shazam! It tells you exactly what is paying! Great app, when it comes to streaming

I have been very satisfied with the movie selections on prime. I do however have some issues with they're loading time and freezing up occasionally. Not that it happens real often but as Murphy's Law puts it... always when I'm in the middle of a good movie, and it just freezes up.. dead stop then it tells me to try reloading again later!

Laggy AF on 300mbps hard wired connection, terrible originals, easily replaced with MAX or Netflix. Prime isn't worth it anymore, music is worthless unless you pay for it on top of your prime membership, YouTube music is vastly better in every way. They can't even deliver packages on time anymore. They keep terminating and limiting services despite charging more and more money. Now photos is discontinued and they're going to delete my photos!!

I used to love it, but in the last few months the rental agreement screen won't open, essentially making it impossible for me to rent anything. There's no update available and resetting my phone isn't the issue. I'm at a loss on what to do. It's super annoying. I got rid of all other streaming platforms before all this started happening and now I'm left staring at a list of movies I can't seem to watch.

Absolutely fabulous and so easy to use! As long as you have Prime then you are set and can watch on the Prime App and even download movies and shows from anywhere! I love it! Say your laptop needs charging and you're in the middle of watching something and are really into it, well charge that laptop and wach on your phone or tablet without having to login or anything! I also love to watch stuff when I'm having to wait somewhere, like the Doctor's office! It's easy and a life saver!

Not as intuitively designed as Netflix. You're not always able to rate/like the shows, the subtitle selections always reset, the exit out of a phone screen is clunky, ads aren't targeted to interest me (wasted opportunity), not as many high quality Asian or Asian American productions. Difficult to find shows I saved are am interested in.

Lots of lag in the app on android phone & smarttv. The close caption is spotty, doesn't often line up or is missing altogether. This streaming service ha really declined. First putting adds then making you pay not to see them but it isn't applicable to all the shows. Moving to other more reliable streaming services.

My playback speeds always get messed up, haven't been able to fix it, and tried everything. Also, the app will not allow me to play any videos on my TV from my phone at all. But I can with Netflix. My playback speeds are always perfect on Netflix. I can't watch Prime anymore AT ALL because of how choppy and weird all the videos are.

Got a decent selection of stuff to watch. Problem is, unless watching it and not hearing it correctly is what you're into it's almost not worth watching. Audio never lines up, fades out when people talk and gets super loud for sound effects. It's like a 4 year old got into the audio settings and just had his way with it.

I appreciate that Amazon prime has a wide variety of video products, many of them free, and I can download them for the base Amazon subscription. I heavily utilize other benefits that come with my annual subscription and it is an amazing bargain. Since the introduction of tiered memberships on other streaming apps where you can't download video unless you pay for a higher tier, that makes the Amazon subscription even more valuable relative to other streaming apps. Amazon does customer service.

I am not very happy with this app. It doesn't have very much you can watch without paying extra and everything that is included has commercials. There are apps that cost half of the price and have lots of movies and content to watch without paying extra or having to watch commercials . I don't think I would recommend it to a friend. Needs more free content for the dollar amount paid.

Barely usable for me. Whenever the app closes fully, it just gives me a black screen and I can't sign in when I open it. I tried restarting and force stopping, but the only way it would work for me again is if I uninstall then reinstall the app. It's already on the low tier for streaming app services. The only positive is the X-ray feature to see who's on screen. UPDATE: Doesn't work at all now whether I reinstall the app or not. Absolutely unusable now. Uninstalled permanently now

You can't customize the page layout, nor create your own customized playlist. Instead, you're forced to look at all of the media that you'll never watch. It's not designed around your purchases, it's designed around their advertising so they can feed you more stupid stuff to buy. Just like all other "smart" technology, it's getting dumber.

There's only 4 problems I have with this app. 1st the app does get a black screen sometimes for me within the app, 2ndbut now it happened during the launch of the app, I deleted several times and redownload with no luck, 3rd the app jumps from one page to the next, so I'll go to search and type in Maxwell Caulfield and then as I'm scrolling through searches it jumps back to the search homepage, 4th A new error now is after jumping back it wouldn't let me click on my saved searches, that's why 3

I like prime has some of my favorite shows. But, just recently the auto play next episode stopped working. I've Uninstaller the app, went into settings to make sure the auto play next episode was turned on, restarted my phone and re-installed the app, and still the auto play next episode doesn't work. Very very frustrating. Needs to be fixed bug or glitch.

Not a fan of: Pushing ad-based viewing (Freevee) excessively, "New to Prime" movies rarely show what is truly new, "recommendations" and "because you watched" are partially correct and majority Prime pushed media (mostly not applicable) to what i watch. Recommendation: Have a selection to remove movie/show from "watchlist/watching now" without having to "hide video".

Always could be better for paid users. Still there's only so much that's free,but so much more in app subscriptions for all the things you would really like to see and why you pay your subscription to begin with. Yet, almost all the good stuff your shaken down for more money. Paid for subscription while still being nickeled and dimed to watch as a paid subscriber!

Too expensive and hardly nooooo content, mostly older movies! And not that they have raised the price of you want ad free, it's really not worth the price it used to be!!! Most probably dropping this steaming service because I have others that show the same thing as amazon prime! Stick to delivering packages people! It's what you know best!!!

Thank You for new addition of ads to all Content!!! I really mean thanks, but No thanks of course. I'll be deleting the video app. You can also take that ad free for only $2.99 offer and stick it where the sun don't shine. As It is you raised the prime membership rates to compensate for the addition of the movie's, music and so on.

If I want to rewatch an episode it now puts me at the end. Won't let you pause or click fast enough to stop it from jumping to the next episode. Then constantly wants me to rate it everytime so when this happens and you're trying to restart your episode, you're simply fckd. Even going back to the previous episode, if you can, fast forwarding to the end so it'll automatically restart the next one, it jumps to the end again and skips instead of restarting. Have more problems! No more room!

Great Content -- Interface could be better As a retired person, I thoroughly enjoy watching historical documentaries, adventure series, and the like. Whoever decided the scope of offerings on Prime Video is certainly to be commended. It would be nice to have a place to save favorite series or shows so that one not have to wade through several screens in order to rewatch a particular item.

Its an ok app considering you can pair subscriptions, not any cheaper but still.. the down side is it's kinda a mess and you always have to see movies from freevveee... And that sucks! Because of the ads. Also there is barley anything to watch despite vast collection, half are in different languages or have voice overs... Hate unsynchronized mouth movement and bad commentary!

Honestly the basic functions could be better. Users have complained for years that the subtitle playback is awful and it's never been fixed. The browsing option is crude at best, not to mention the genre labeling/options is subpar. I like prime and I like the shows and movies they bring, but their app sucks and they never do a thing about it.

Sometimes the Auto play doesn't work well. If I pause on my device to do something I come back and have to start over again because it stay where I paused it. I been reading what other customers has post about this app their having problem as well. It's some kind malware going on. You guy's need to fix the app if you wanna keep getting people money.

It has gotten worse over the years. Everything has to be purchased or deal with commercials even though we already pay for a membership. When I first used it years ago it gave real value. Now it has become nothing more than an online store constantly pushing products. Everything I used to like is behind a paywall and when it is available it is only on Freevee which constantly interrupts with commercials. That was what free tv was in my childhood, not how a paid service should be.

Movies and shows stream fine. I get annoyed with the ads. The same ones all the time. If you need to fast forward or rewind, you have to watch the ads over again. And what's with the ads in Spanish? I heard that Amazon is trying to be culturally sensitive, but I figure if someone is watching a TV show in English, then they can watch commercials in English also. The system is probably smart enough to know the difference. I already pay for Prime, so why should I still have to watch so many ads?

I pay for streaming services to avoid commercials and then get an email letting me know they are soon going to start implementing ads, making obsolete the reason why I pay for their service and then they wanna charge me an extra 4 dollars a month to "avoid" ads after I'm already paying to avoid ads? Just up the price instead of saying "you pay a premium for no ads but now we are putting ads in anyway....unless of course you pay us even more!" Legal theft. I can watch my cable TV for that.

despite this fact that I have purchase every season of The classic Addams family TV show this app defaults to the option that plays the TV show with ads. it's extremely difficult to get to content that I have purchased, and it's not user friendly. it also shows me things that I have to pay to watch over things that are included with the app..

Forces you to edit notifications to not get ads. It's easy enough to get rid of them if you're familiar with Android but maybe they should have asked us for our permission. And the selection is bad because it's tied to a service you already use so there's no reason to be impressed with what's available even if it was comparable to other evil streaming services.

First of all, these ads are a joke. You're paying for a service, and then they add an additional fee to use the service without ads. Disgusting. I've always had some technical issues with Prime, especially when using through a Smart TV - shows not loading, error messages popping up etc. So to have this new development on top of that is infuriating.

Useless. Got this on my iPad and it's a nightmare watching shows. Ads play every two-three minutes, when the shows aren't designed to have ad breaks. Also, half of the time, the app gets confused after the ad, and it changes the episode we're watching. Oh and at the beginning of every episode, the show starts at the end, I then manually have to set the episode to start from the beginning. Worst user experience I could have asked for. Fml never paying for prime again if I can avoid it.

You would expect better from this company, but I do not think it is worthwhile to pay for this on its own. Of course most will get it along with prime benefits. Once you've watched the few really good 18+ shows, there is very little high quality content, especially for the whole family. Beyond that, the app is not great; search options and filters are bad, etc. It shows you all kinds of things to watch but half of them are not included with prime and require another subscription. 1 month & done

Good shows and great app, kinda bummed out that only 2 episodes of the last season of Supernatural are available but other than that it's great. The "x-ray" thing is cool but I'd prefer if I could enable/disable as I please and switch between being able to double click to go forward or backward by 10 seconds.

Used to be good. Until, I found one evening that I could no longer buy a movie to watch in bed. You are now forced to use the app on the fire stick/TV, or go to a separate website. This is inconvenient and not what I originally paid for. A lot of the movies are not in English, and dubbed over, (I personally can't watch these). There seems to be less and less good quality content and more an more advertising, and films from non English speaking countries. If price's go up this is first to go.

Could be better. You cant search movies or tv shows by genre, so makes it hatder to find something to watch. If you are watching a show you cant go back to view the episodes, you have to go out and search the show and go into it again to bring up the episodes. Quite annoying. It also comes up with shows or movies when you are searching and yet when you select it its not available on prime, so why even have it come up to select.

Despite of having content which is no surprise since it's Amazon, the app accessibility is straight up garbage. Series not plunged into one but I have to search and add each separate season for a same series. The player is trash as well which does not directly display the next episodes before taking a meaningless step. Not to mention ads being added even after paying for the prime version.

I like the way the app allows me to know who's playing what role while still watching the movie. However, when I say for a movie category, e.g., Nollywood, it'll only show me about 7 or 8 movies, and there's much more than that on the app. I don't find it easy to locate movies I'd love to watch. Moreso, it does not seem like a sizable number of movies are added; I see the same old movies

Was 4 stars down to 1, been a prime member for years, even tho the content or app wasn't the greatest it wasn't horrible, now there's ads in there and you have to pay more money to get rid of them, that's pretty bad when it goes to another episode when you're not done it, then trying to find where you left off you have to watch a couple ads before finally finding the right spot, like a previous review said about corporate greed, I agree 100 percent!!!

Apart from this being terible content, and being FULL of tricky things, that hook you and charge you ( as an example, you start watching a tv series, which is free, then is only availeble to rent or buy, and no, i dont mean other seasons, i mean after a few episodes) now you get adds. Yes adds , even though you pay for the damn thing. I've had enough of this, and i will be cancelling my prime membership. Theese guys got too big and too greedy. Is unbelievable. Im disgusted by this.

Disappointed in Amazon greed. I have been a prime client for years and I just opened Prime Video on my smart TV to find the notification that "movies and TV shows included with Prime now have limited ads. You can upgrade to ad free for $2.99/month" Don't change the current subscription service. Create a new service that's like $5.99/month with ads. Corporate greed is disgusting.

The user interface is not great, it's hard to find anything you want to watch and also trying to continue watching a series is also difficult to find as it's hidden in the jumble of garbage shows being rammed at you on the main screen. This is a paid for product but you still shove adverts at the customer before most shows requiring the skip button to be pressed and the best movies are locked behind a paywall requiring to to rent or buy, why do I bother paying for this?

I was watching a show and it went away, I can watch a show from the beginning to end because the older episodes arent available and it doesn't even give me the option to upgrade or anything. No options to change your settings no clear marative to guide a person. It's just bad and I love the shows they have. Why not just do what you offer or say upgrade. Settings is important and this app has nothing

Got the free month trial, and it's a horrible experience so far. There is no button for next episode. Instead, the end of an episode brings me back to the home screen. The method for getting out of fullscreen isn't intuitive at all. I'm still getting ads at the start of episodes. The app hangs when you back out to another tab... Do people seriously pay for this service? This is absolutely dismal. Every time I boot this up, I instantly wish I was on literally any other streaming service. 0.5/10.

Don't like the fact that after closing the app and returning I could only hear the audio on my downloads. I tried streaming a new movie because I thought something was wrong with my downloads but the exact same thing happened. You guys should really work on this or I'll have no choice but to cancel my subscription.

Only got free prime for a month when I was ordering something, so I downloaded the video app and definitely won't be re-subscribing. Unimpressed they put ads on things and you aren't able to skip them. If you are paying for a service there shouldn't be ads even with a freebie month. I would understand them being there if they were offering to watch free of charge as like a tier system.

App crashes. Open it to resume viewing. Get put back onto season 1. Close to go back to season 3. Get an advert. Get jumped to somewhere completely different to where I was before the crash. Try to go back to where I was. Another advert. Amazing paid experience guys!! I love it!! (Sarcasm)

The library's getting worse and worse. It used to have really good TV shows and movies, now they're behind subscription channels and free-with-ads channels and the free catalogue has bad content and B-grade films. The prime subscription even comes with ads now. There's not much point to this service anymore. Netflix is better.

Hard to continue on previously watched shows. And the "promotion" of your Amazon exclusive shows is disgusting. Hiding the skip button behind a bar that come up and stays for 20 sec is a disgusting practice. I've paid for your service already let me decide what I want to watch. Also the fact that when scrolling it's so hard to find shows that are included with my subscription. Remove movies I need to rent from my first page feed. It's like 70% of everything

This app was working fine until it wasn't. Anytime I try to watch a movie, I can only hear the audio with a blank screen. I thought there was a problem with my downloads at first until I tried streaming a new show, and it was the same issue. I even uninstalled and reinstalled the app, and it is the same thing. This is infuriating and is making me seriously consider cancelling my subscription. I would like this resolved as soon as possible

I used to be a big fan of the Prime Video app. Was quite slick, easy to use and the incorporation of imdb was a really nice feature. It seems to have consistently gone downhill over the past few years though and has become quite buggy. The worst "improvement" they've recently made, however, is the inexplicable decision to start streaming in portrait mode and then jump back in to portrait mode after changing subtitles or audio. Just why. Why would anyone want to watch a film or show like this.

UI: Not organized very well. Haven't seen a glimpse of a UI update on the mobile app, browser, or TV app. It wouldn't take many changes to make this better. My favorite feature is X-Ray. It saves me from pausing my phone and going to IMDB so that's a plus! Selection: Could be better, some good classics but new movies are lacking. I'm a horror fan, and the selection is not I already pay for prime, so this is a bonus. I just wish some basic changes could be made.

Terrible. SO MANY ADS! Wth's the point of paying for a subscription to have ads run every 5 minutes. The vid player freezes, but the audio keeps going, or the screen will go black, but the audio continues, or the whole thing crashes. The majority of what you want to watch is locked behind different pay walls. The CC either doesn't exist, is out sync with the audio, or gibberish. They don't seem to care at all as there's plenty of reviews saying the same things. GARBAGE!

Trying to be different then Netflix has its price. I really miss the brighness control through the app, which is critical on mobile! I LOVE the imdb info on cast, this is the best feature ever. Very bad inter device continuity! You get to a different place on another device if I want to continue watching, it offers different episodes. If you will go to the right one, you will usually see the area where you stopped. Although not accurate as in Netflix. This app has a lot to improve.

Overall good, but sometimes I start something, go back later and find that the movie is now rent or buy, I don't like this feature. If people have started something, let them finish it then add the rent option. Or just don't have it, we are already paying to watch Prime, so please, don't charge us for films, especially when certain films are free on other platforms, which most people have more than one platform. More movies free, will keep more people co.ing back for more.

The app is good, but I don't like the "X Ray" screen that appears when I play a video. Seems just like a tedious extra step. The video player should have touch volume and brightness controls. I hate the fact that you have to subscribe to additional channels or services to access content (lionsgate etc) on top of your prime subscription. A lot of changes can be made to the app. As a prime subscriber I don't like to see ads on my video at the start (trailers, promos, etc).

The app was completely unusable for a while but they have addressed that. The UI is still well below what other streaming services offer, both in responsiveness and ease of use. I tried to report some errors but customer service is obviously not where the money's going either. It all feels terribly amateurish. I'm paying for this service and yet I get trailers for random movies every time I try to watch something and I cannot disable that "feature". That's not putting the customer first.

For a company that I imagine makes millions charging customers for its 'prime' service, the app is unresponsive, slow, glitchy, audio is out of sync, rare for it to work first time, even running the app through a fire stick you would think it would work better. Now much of the subscription included content is buried behind all the additional stuff they want you to pay extra for. For the amount you pay you get very little included in your subscription.

Prime Video was great when it was released, but then they decided to start charging extra for certain shows. Now, they've decided to extort additional money from their customers by forcing them to pay extra to avoid adverts. You either charge a fee or show ads, not both. As such I'll be allowing my membership to lapse and deleting the app once it expires.

Whenever I try to cast it on tv via Google Chrome cast it doesn't work. When I try to cast to screen it makes my phone screen glitch and I have to restart my phone so I can use it. I've tried to report the bug multiple times but this issue keeps happening. Another annoying thing is, I keep getting ads before my video plays even though I pay for a subscription- there is a skip button but I shouldn't need to go through ads with paid subscription. It's a shame, there's a good variety of shows.

It's a really waste of money for using this app. Those movies just keep disappearing or removed by admin. Then what's the point we are paying for? Can't watch what we want. In a few days, those were in favourite turns to unavailable. It's just useless seriously. Better don't need to pay. This prime video system should upgrade their storage and should make people happy for what we are paying instead of being removed. Try to upgrade so we can watch it anytime as we want. That's what we paid for !

I love Amazon's huge varied library (compared to Netflix) with lots of indie stuff and documentaries. However why is it when you search certain actors/actresses and it comes up with results of movie or series there's some when you click it says it isn't available to watch? Why not just remove from the app? also When I've downloaded a title to watch offline and then turn the Internet back on I get "download error" message that says I have to download it all over again.. please fix this.

I'm not sure what's going on with it but when you get a programme suggestion, it's automatically playing it and if I don't press back up quickly enough it's added to my list of shows I'm watching! It's done this twice in 24hrs. I wish we could solve problems like this by deleting shows from our viewing list.

I like this app, however can you guys actually improve it because it keeps lagging more than 7 times an episode. The audio with keep playing but the actual video part won't. And then sometimes both won't work at the same time. For all the money you guys have, video and audio performance seems to be right down the drain and outside the episodes is only where there is actually any good in this app. Even watching it on my laptop, on the actual website is better than this.

It's tedious watching tv shows on one device and picking it up on another at a later time. Shoot, even on the same device it will send me back to an episode anywhere from 1-3 previous. I hate auto rotate but I have to enable it if I'm watching a show on the go. Closed captions are more often out of sync than the time they are accurate. Again this is on fire stick, PS5, Android 12 & 13. Other then thise three pain points, it's great.

Much programming is suitable for the whole family. Including adults. Many choices are available which are intelligent without being disgusting. A little awkward to choose seasons and episodes. I inadvertantly get stuck in the rent or buy section, which is annoying. My choices seem to appear and disappear for no reason. I'm often informed that I am suddenly not subscribed, then it works again for no apparent reason. Many good program choices available!!!

Prime of amazon, one of the largest multinational companies of the world but still the app is not so always pleaureable to use. Frequent crashes, longer time to open the app (in the same time netflix opens up), one cannot download while surfing the app prime(which one can in netflix). Customer service is quick and very good... And yes most of the good movies are now under rent so i dont feel there is any need to continue the subscription.

Killing the fun. Recently implemented commercials for default subscriptions. Within an episode/movie, that's a show-stopper. Most content is rental/buy anyway. Searching/Browsing is side-scrolling hell. Scenes with much darkness or music only are constantly lagging (chromecast) - possibly hosted on slow servers, because who would enjoy intro/credits as part of an artistic concept? Often enough you'll need to avoid automatical cut-off of film-music by hitting some ugly huge overlay.

Now Amazon want to charge more money for new movies.
